sentences.en: A frown marred his handsome features.
sentences.cn: 紧锁的眉头破坏了他俊美的面容。

sentences.en: A hovering mar - of - war bird showed him where dolphin were chasing some flying fish.
sentences.cn: 一只盘旋的军舰鸟给他指明了海豚追逐飞鱼的地方.

sentences.en: Don't allow a minor irritation in the workplace to mar your ambitions.
sentences.cn: 不要让工作中的一点烦心事打击了你的雄心抱负。

sentences.en: Few propaganda posters mar the landscape, and martial music is rarely heard.
sentences.cn: 几处宣传海报损毁了这美丽风景, 并且军歌也很少听到.

sentences.en: Habitat and ecology: In valleys or in thickets. Flowering: Mar. - Apr.
sentences.cn: 生境与生态: 生于山谷、灌丛. 花期: 3-4月.

sentences.en: I am helping you to mar that which God made, a poor unworthy brother of yours.
sentences.cn: 我帮你糟蹋那上帝造的你那个可怜没出息的兄弟呢.

sentences.en: In twenty years of mar-riage he has only taken two proper vacations.
sentences.cn: 结婚二十年里，他只像样地度过两次假。

sentences.en: It was not the custom for elderly people to mar the picnics with their presence.
sentences.cn: 大人们照例不参加这样的野餐以免扫兴.

sentences.en: Just under half of all mar - riages end in divorce.
sentences.cn: 几乎二分之一的婚姻是以离婚收场.

sentences.en: Mar 14:42 Rise! Let us go! Here comes my betrayer!
sentences.cn: 42起来! 我们走吧. 看哪,那卖我的人近了.

sentences.en: Mar 14:46 The men seized Jesus and arrested him.
MAR All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
sentences.cn: 只工作不玩耍,聪明杰克也变傻.

sentences.en: MAR, GMP - 140 were higher and EPM was lower in treated group than those in healthy group.
sentences.cn: 与老年人健康组比较,LI组MAR和 GMP-140水平升高,而EPM水平降低.

sentences.en: Mend your speech a little, Lest it may mar your fortune.
sentences.cn: 注意你的言行, 免得破坏你的好运.

sentences.en: The lord would say, I thought, he would mar a good dinner.
sentences.cn: 于是这位贵族就说:“我早就料到他一定会把一桌好筵席弄坏的”.

sentences.en: Their wedding was marred by the death of Jenny’s mother a week earlier.
sentences.cn: 一周之前珍妮母亲的过世使他们的婚礼蒙上了一层阴影。

sentences.en: This round of on - line application will start on Mar 16, 2006.
sentences.cn: 此轮在线申请将从2006年3月16日正式开始.

trans.tran_cn: 弄坏, 毁坏, 损害
trans.tran_en: to make something less attractive or enjoyable

trans.tran_cn: 毁坏，损坏，弄糟，糟蹋，玷污
trans.tran_en: to make something less attractive or enjoyable
to make something less attractive or enjoyable
